resources.CarInventoryManagement

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.CarInventoryManagement.Console

  •  class Console
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • printMenu

        void printMenu()
        Prints the menu with all the currently available options.

      • showCars

        void showCars()
        Prints out the current database. This will print what is currently in memory, but not necessarily what is currently written to the file.

      • addCar

        boolean addCar(java.util.Scanner kb)
        Attempts to add a new vehicle to the database in memory. This only succeeds if all the fields successfully pass validation.
        Parameters:
        kb - The scanner object used to read in from the console
        Returns:
        True if a vehicle was successfully added to the database in memory, false if something went wrong.

      • deleteCar

        boolean deleteCar(java.util.Scanner kb)
        Attempts to delete a vehicle from the database in memory. The vehicle is located by VIN number. This does not necessarily mean the change is permanently written to the database file.
        Parameters:
        kb - The scanner object used to read in from the console
        Returns:
        True if the vehicle was located and deleted, false otherwise

      • searchCar

        void searchCar(java.util.Scanner kb)
        Allows searching the database in memory for a certain vehicle by VIN number
        Parameters:
        kb - The scanner object used to read in from the console

      • showPriceRange

        void showPriceRange(java.util.Scanner kb)
        Allows searching the database in memory for cars whose prices fall within a specified range.
        Parameters:
        kb - The scanner object used to read in from the console

      • writeDatabase

        void writeDatabase()
        Attempts to write the current database in memory to a file called cars.txt as plain text. If this effort fails, it will indicate so with an error message. If it succeeds, it will likewise indicate.
